body: @corneadoug fixed the z.run() case in bdf703d

There seems to be no problem. Could you merge this PR? :-)
Maybe we should also update the documentation so people know they can use it on python
Thanks, I'm merging it into master.

I agree - in the existing doc the code is in images - should we double those with python version? I'd prefer having text for code - it would be easier to copy/paste to test it out

Text one could be better.

CI failing is irrelevant. 

Thanks. Looks good to me.

Hi @lresende,
This option should be deprecated starting from jekyll 2.0,
however we are using version 1.3 in this doc, so I'm not seeing any warning on my side
Tested, I think its good to merge

Merging if there is no more discussions
@r-kamath seems there is some test failing
I've tested it. LGTM with adding a tutorial in dynamicform

This may be totally unrelated, but, both $.fn.jquery and jQuery.fn.jquery returns "2.1.4"; which means $ is pointing to jQuery. Shouldn't we allow only one of these, so that its always more readable.

Otherwise Looks good to me, gets compiled well, runs well.
Working well. LGTM

@prabhjyotsingh good point, actually none of them should be authorized.
Usually we ask people not to use $ or jQuery if it's not in a directive, however it was done in some cases.
However since people use it, we ask that to be made with the help of `angular.element`.
There might be a few leftover in the code that are not using it, bit this should be the work of another PR
added doc and rebased

Thanks @Leemoonsoo, have made relevant changes.

Trying to debug, will update once finished.
Ready to merge

generally I think it's ok if it is minor/patch version [differences](http://semver.org/).
but for 1.5.x vs 1.6 or 1.x vs 2.0 - I am not sure we should automatically assume compatibility.

for instance there is a new version with py4j jar for Spark 1.6.0 that I plan to address in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-395

That make sense.

Which do you prefer? When Spark is future version, we can either print some warning log then continue, or raise exception to not working with it.

Thanks @jongyoul @felixcheung for the feedback.

I'm merging this PR if there're no more discussions

I think this is going to be really useful, thanks. One suggestion is, if it can keep space between unchanged, it will be better. Because of i've seen some use cases that have many paragraph with complex layout, that carefully adjusted to fit in the screen for dashboard purpose.
I will test that out
LGTM
Oops. I'll check it, too.
@corneadoug Thank you for your kindness. I will try as your way.
LGTM
LGTM

I like the idea, it will improve user experience a lot.

I found there are few things need to be handled.
There are 3 different look&feel modes in Zeppelin which are `default`, `simple`, `report`.
After this PR paragraph's button group overlaps paragraph border in `simple` mode.
Before:
![2015-11-19 1 41 21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8503346/11262581/5bbdc0dc-8ec4-11e5-8e42-a2fb56f58db5.png)
After:
![default](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8503346/11262615/bd945a0a-8ec4-11e5-9da3-7e718d5f42c3.png)
And in `report` mode Zeppelin doesn't have ability to add new paragraph, so it will be better to disable this feature for consistency.
Good to Go!
Thanks for review. i'm merging.

If it's minor/patch version difference, maybe we could warn and continue?
I think it would be nice to have a message in the notebook output, if it's in the log file then it's not very discoverable.
No jQuery either, only angular.element
Ready to merge
@minahlee @felixcheung Thanks for feedback. i pushed new commits and changed this PR's scope to cover BASE_PATH change, too. As a followup of #430, #431

@corneadoug  I was thinking to do that in a separate PR. Can do it here as well. 

What about perfectScrollbar, can I just remove all references of that as well ?

@prabhjyotsingh if we want to unify it all, better doing it once, and the way it should be (angular.element)
Not sure what you mean by perfectScrollbar, it is used only twice and not as a keyword (and it is needed)

Done, replaced jQuery with angular.element.
Please ignore perfectScrollbar thing, got it confused with something else.
Alright, just tell us when your PR is finished so that we can review/test it

Yes, was waiting for travis to complete.
Ready for review.
Can we also cover insertion via keyboard shortcuts, ideally the same as ipython (http://johnlaudun.org/20131228-ipython-notebook-keyboard-shortcuts/) ?
looks good
I noticed that too, looks good.
About keyboard shortcuts, it's better to be discussed in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-391. But i think it make sense to have ipython or jupyter inspired keyboard shortcut.
I think thats good for merge

It would be nice to have one under the last paragraph also.

One question about Multiple paragraphs in the same row.
In this PR, we have this:
![screen shot 2015-11-20 at 11 47 15 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/710411/11290705/a7b6a928-8f7c-11e5-9150-04eb6e4860cc.png)
Do we want to keep that behavior, or have only one + button bar per row?
@felixcheung  I have updated code to allow minor/patch version difference, but print error message on the notebook when major version is unsupported.
Thanks for the quick review :smile:
looks good
I will merge if there is no more comments

Tested and working nicely both with/without -Pbuild-distr

Thanks for nice fix.
LGTM

I have rebased to resolve conflict with master branch.
Ready to merge.

Hi, I just built your branch and I also enabled authentication editing shiro.ini. Now I get the browser asking for the password, but I can just cancel  the request and I am able to do everything, including executing scala code. Maybe I am missing something about how this patch is supposed to work...
By cancelling you get access as an anonymous user aka public notes only.

Yes but cancelling I am still able to create a public note, and in a public note I can still write whatsoever code. It may protect the notes but it does not protect the system from being abused... Is it not possible to block access to not-authenticated users?

Hi
I just added a boolean property (zeppelin.anonymous.allowed) at the end of the file conf/zeppelin-site.xml that when to false will block not-auhtenticated users.

Test added. and version check in SparkSqlInterperter, SparkInterpreter, PySparkInterpreter.

Ready to merge.
Merge if there're no more discussions.
Looks good to me.
looks good
@corneadoug @Leemoonsoo build issues are fixed
Ready to merge

[.travis.yml](https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/.travis.yml#L30) file builds multiple times for some reason. So you'll need to search for all build logs, not the last one. I usually search text "Reactor Summary" first, to see if there're any build fail.
Aborting a pending status paragraph clears the output of paragraph, but earlier it used to retain it. Otherwise looks good, and a really useful feature.
Tested, works as expected on FF, chrome, safari, IE10 and Edge (12)

Thanks @Leemoonsoo while importing any external library I'll keep this in mind for next time.

Resolved build failure, ready for review.
